description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

1.2.description:
- By default, checks for winning races/battles on specific difficulties is disabled, it is now a toggleable option to enable these checks
- By default, there are less Afloat Trophys than before, it is now a toggleable option to add the previous amount to the item pool
- Added a description for an optional personal rule in the readme
1.2.title: 1.2 Update

V1.0.title: Mario Kart 7 Manual APworld by BigBradley V1.0

V1.1.description: Combined both APworld options into one. Can now play with Local or Global Trophys, or have both.
V1.1.title: 1.1 Update, Only One APworld and YAML Now

V1.2.2.description:
- Fixed some bugs with Extended Mode
- Re-added proper checks for Metal Mario and Beast Glider

V1.2.3.description:
Hopefully the final update.
- Removed the requirement of winning on specific tracks/courses with a customisable. Now the player can win on any track/course with a specific customisable
- Removed the "enable_racing" option, as it is no longer required for anything
- Added option descriptions to the default yaml, now making the default template yaml valid
- Fixed a few logic and visual bugs
- rewrote some miscellaneous stuff
V1.2.3.title: V1.2.3
